content: On October 26, 1995, the Atlanta Braves clinched their first World Series title since moving to Atlanta, defeating the Cleveland Indians in Game 6. Tom Glavine delivered a masterful performance, throwing eight shutout innings and allowing just one hit, while the Braves' offense was powered by a two-run homer from David Justice. The victory marked a significant achievement for the franchise, solidifying their place in baseball history with their first championship in Atlanta.
